description.narrative: Climate Box adapted and ready for dissemination in four target Europe and CIS countries to promote education and awareness on climate change impacts and drivers.

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Promoted Education and awareness on climate change impacts and drivers among ECIS youth and general public 1.1 # of new Europe and CIS (ECIS) countries for which the Climate Box developed and prepared for dissemination 1.2. # of ECIS countries where approval received from national authorities on application of Climate Box
Increased awareness of some 30,000 school kids and increased capacity of teachers on Climate Change through the piloting of the CB in seven ECIS countries participating in the project 2.1 # of teachers trained on Climate box introduction in four new countries 2.2 # of students got acquainted with Climate box
Climate change learning and awareness campaigns based on the Climate Box tool-kit outreached a wider audience across ECIS. The advocacy events represent extensive educational and awareness value. 3.1 # of climate boxes distributed 3.2 # of visitors on the Climate Box website 3.3 # of downloads of mobile application 3.4 # of press references and dedicated press briefings on Climate Box and climate change catalyzed by the Climate box 3.5 # of awareness events organized under Climate Box project and outreach 3.6 # and quality of climate-related projects prepared by kids for the youth competition 3.7 # of teachers participating in the regional exchange events

comment.narrative:
1.1 There were no coherent courses on climate change in the school curricular. A number of regional initiatives have developed some educational materials in the past but those were neither comprehensive nor sustainable, didn’t include high quality graphics and interactive materials. Climate Box was developed and successfully piloted in Russia, but required editing/adaptation to the local context for further dissemination in the ECIS countries. 1.2 - 0
2.1 - Teachers in the four new countries are not yet familiar with the Climate Box 2.2 - Climate Box is not piloted in ECIS region beyond Russia and one school in Kazakhstan. Piloting experience is available.
3.1, 3.2, 3.3, 3.4 and 3.5 - Awareness of Climate Change issues both among kids and adults is insufficient. Most of the available information is focused on scientists and policy makers rather than on general public and kids. 3.6 - School kids in ECIS region outside of Russia are not using Climate Box yet (except for one school in Kazakhstan) 3.7 - There is no climate change knowledge exchange between teachers of the region established

Finalize and launch new interactive Climate Box web-portal. Operational and financial closure of the project.
Promoted Education and awareness on climate change impacts and drivers among ECIS youth and general public 1.1 # of new Europe and CIS (ECIS) countries for which the Climate Box developed and prepared for dissemination - 4 1.2. # of ECIS countries where approval received from national authorities on application of Climate Box - 4
Increased awareness of some 30,000 school kids and increased capacity of teachers on Climate Change through the piloting of the CB in seven ECIS countries participating in the project 2.1 # of teachers trained on Climate box introduction in four new countries - 300 2.2 # of students got acquainted with Climate box - 15,000
Climate change learning and awareness campaigns based on the Climate Box tool-kit outreached a wider audience across ECIS. The advocacy events represent extensive educational and awareness value. 3.1 # of climate boxes distributed - 3500 3.2 # of visitors on the Climate Box website - 2000 3.3 # of downloads of mobile application - n/a 3.4 # of press references and dedicated press briefings on Climate Box and climate change catalyzed by the Climate box - 70 3.5 # of awareness events organized under Climate Box project and outreach - 14 3.6 # and quality of climate-related projects prepared by kids for the youth competition - 21 3.7 # of teachers participating in the regional exchange events - 30

The Regional Project Board reviewed annual and mid-year project reports and endorsed project extension until 31 March 2021. The project identified lessons learnt with improvements that need to be made for the next phase of the project. These include areas such as closing the knowledge gap in the issue of climate change problem, improvements in alternative online learning application and education platforms, and new educational IT and communication tools, amongst many others.
A concluding event for the project was held during 29 – 30 June 2021 to reflect upon the achievements of Climate Box throughout the region. Due to the COVID-19 travel restrictions, the event was held online on Zoom. The objectives of the virtual event were to discuss climate education, raise awareness, and promote further engagement in the ECA region. 300 participants were able to join the event from across the region, participating in three different sessions organized for high level representatives, teachers as well as youth.
In 2021, the new web-portal was launched. The new Portal includes Climate Box materials in English and in Russian as well as downloadable versions in all other languages. The Portal includes a special section for teachers (“Teachers’ Space”) with the technical guidance and learning materials and with the moderated discussion space for teachers and education experts. The portal also includes a section for managing school project competitions. The work on the portal was completed in the 1st Quarter of 2021. The website is now launched and can be accessed through: https://climate-box.com/.
As per the results submitted in the Annual Report June 2021:
Promoted Education and awareness on climate change impacts and drivers among ECIS youth and general public 1.1 # of new Europe and CIS (ECIS) countries for which the Climate Box developed and prepared for dissemination - 5 1.2. # of ECIS countries where approval received from national authorities on application of Climate Box - 5
Increased awareness of some 30,000 school kids and increased capacity of teachers on Climate Change through the piloting of the CB in seven ECIS countries participating in the project 2.1 # of teachers trained on Climate box introduction in four new countries - 3,956 2.2 # of students got acquainted with Climate box - 85,400
Climate change learning and awareness campaigns based on the Climate Box tool-kit outreached a wider audience across ECIS. The advocacy events represent extensive educational and awareness value. 3.1 # of climate boxes distributed - More than 6,300 3.2 # of visitors on the Climate Box website - more than 2000 3.3 # of downloads of mobile application - n/a (Mobile app. Has been discontinued. Activities will be supported through the upgraded interactive web-portal) 3.4 # of press references and dedicated press briefings on Climate Box and climate change catalyzed by the Climate box - Overall >100 3.5 # of awareness events organized under Climate Box project and outreach - 20 3.6 # and quality of climate-related projects prepared by kids for the youth competition - 26 3.7 # of teachers participating in the regional exchange events - 104

The project has been successfully implemented in all eight beneficiary countries. Most of the planned activities have been completed. The Climate Box was translated to the local languages of all eight beneficiary countries (Armenian, Belarussian, Kyrgyz, Kazakh, Romanian, Tajik, Turkmen, Uzbek and Karakalpak) and adapted to the national curricular. A series of training-of-trainers have been completed. In 2020 the CO in Serbia has joined the programme through the UNDP Climate promise. The teachers’ training module commissioned by the IRH has been duly delivered. Printing and publication of the national toolkits has been finalized by the beneficiary Country Offices. The Climate Box toolkit has been translated to Spanish, French and Arabic, the translated versions are posted at UNDP web site. The design of the new multi-lingual Climate Box web-portal has been commissioned through an international procurement. Due to the delays in the procurement and signature of the contract for the design of the web-portal as a result of the COVID pandemic, the vendor was not able delivering the final multi-lingual web-portal by the end of 2020 and requested to adjust the timeframe for the final deliverable to 1st Quarter 2021. All the remaining project funds have been committed to activities endorsed by the Project Board and no further delays are expected besides the delivery of the web-portal.

The toolkit has been presented to educational authorities in all 4 new countries, translation of the toolkit into local languages completed. Second regional education conference and the 1st school context has been conducted in Almaty, Kazakhstan. The project is presented at UNFCCC events.
Results against indicators: Promoted Education and awareness on climate change impacts and drivers among ECIS youth and general public 1.1 # of new Europe and CIS (ECIS) countries for which the Climate Box developed and prepared for dissemination - 4 1.2. # of ECIS countries where approval received from national authorities on application of Climate Box - 4
Increased awareness of some 30,000 school kids and increased capacity of teachers on Climate Change through the piloting of the CB in seven ECIS countries participating in the project 2.1 # of teachers trained on Climate box introduction in four new countries - 2900 2.2 # of students got acquainted with Climate box - 60,000
Climate change learning and awareness campaigns based on the Climate Box tool-kit outreached a wider audience across ECIS. The advocacy events represent extensive educational and awareness value. 3.1 # of climate boxes distributed - indicator to be reported in the future years 3.2 # of visitors on the Climate Box website - new web portal will be commissioned 3.3 # of downloads of mobile application - n/a, mobile app was discontinued and will be replaced with the new interactive web portal 3.4 # of press references and dedicated press briefings on Climate Box and climate change catalyzed by the Climate box - 70 3.5 # of awareness events organized under Climate Box project and outreach - 20 3.6 # and quality of climate-related projects prepared by kids for the youth competition - 26 3.7 # of teachers participating in the regional exchange events - 100
